title: accordance with the Fifth Schedule, of the Universities Act 1997 (No. 24 of
heading: 1. CITATION
text_raw:
1. CITATION 

This Scheme may be cited as the University College Dublin (Model) 
Superannuation Scheme 2023.
text_norm: 1 citation scheme may cited university college dublin (model) superannuation scheme 2023

title: accordance with the Fifth Schedule, of the Universities Act 1997 (No. 24 of
heading: 2. COMMENCEMENT
text_raw:
2. COMMENCEMENT 

This Scheme shall be deemed to have commenced with effect from 1 January
text_norm: 2 commencement scheme shall deemed commenced effect 1 january

title: accordance with the Fifth Schedule, of the Universities Act 1997 (No. 24 of
accordance with the Fifth Schedule, of the Universities Act 1997 (No. 24 of
heading: 3. ADOPTION OF RULES FOR PRE-EXISTING PUBLIC SERVICE
text_raw:
3. ADOPTION OF RULES FOR PRE-EXISTING PUBLIC SERVICE 

PENSION SCHEME MEMBERS 

The rules set out in the Rules for Pre-Existing Public Service Pension Scheme 
Members Regulations 2014 (S.I. No. 582 of 2014) (hereinafter called “The 
Regulations”) are adopted as the rules of this Scheme for the purposes of Article 
2 of the Regulations, subject to the modifications specified in Articles 4, 5 and
text_norm: 3 adoption rule pre-existing public service pension scheme member rule set rule pre-existing public service pension scheme member regulation 2014 (s.i no 582 2014) (hereinafter called regulation ) adopted rule scheme purpose article 2 regulation subject modification specified article 4 5

title: accordance with the Fifth Schedule, of the Universities Act 1997 (No. 24 of
accordance with the Fifth Schedule, of the Universities Act 1997 (No. 24 of
heading: 4. ARTICLE 5 OF THE REGULATIONS. MEMBERSHIP
text_raw:
4. ARTICLE 5 OF THE REGULATIONS. MEMBERSHIP 

(a) 

In Article 5(2)(a) of the Regulations the following is inserted after 
the words “relevant body,”– 

“or who is an active member of the University College Dublin, 
National University of Ireland, Dublin (Closed) Pension Scheme 
2010 as set out in S.I. 96 of 2010,” 

(b) 

In Article 5(2)(b) of the Regulations, 

“who is not a new entrant and whose actual pensionable service 
on attaining age 65 would be less than the vesting period, or” 

is deleted and the following is inserted in its place— 

“who is not a new entrant and whose actual pensionable service 
on attaining age 70 would be less than the vesting period, or” 

(c) 

In Article 5(5) of the Regulations, 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 1st September, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [429] 3 

“A member who is not a new entrant may not continue in 
membership after having reached the age of 65.” 

is deleted and the following is inserted in its place— 

“A member who is not a new entrant may not continue in 
membership after having reached the age of 70.”

title: accordance with the Fifth Schedule, of the Universities Act 1997 (No. 24 of
heading: 5. ARTICLE 7 OF THE REGULATIONS. CONTRIBUTIONS FOR
text_raw:
5. ARTICLE 7 OF THE REGULATIONS. CONTRIBUTIONS FOR 

PERSONAL SCHEME BENEFITS 

In Article 7(3) of the Regulations – 

“5% of pensionable remuneration or,” is deleted.
text_norm: 5 article 7 regulation contribution personal scheme benefit article 7(3) regulation - 5 pensionable remuneration deleted

title: accordance with the Fifth Schedule, of the Universities Act 1997 (No. 24 of
heading: 6. ARTICLE 29 OF THE REGULATIONS. SURVIVOR’S PENSION
text_raw:
6. ARTICLE 29 OF THE REGULATIONS. SURVIVOR’S PENSION 

- CALCULATION 

In Article 29(3) of the Regulations – 

“In the case where the former member dies while in receipt of a pension, 
other than a pension based on Article 18 (Cost Neutral Early Retirement), 
a preserved pension or a pension awarded on medical grounds” 

is deleted and the following is inserted in its place – 

“In the case where the former member dies while in receipt of a pension, 
other than a pension based on Article 17 (Cost Neutral Early Retirement), 
a preserved pension or a pension awarded on medical grounds” 

The Minister for Further and Higher Education, Research, Innovation and 
Science hereby consents to the foregoing Scheme. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

30 August, 2023. 

SIMON HARRIS, 

Minister for Further and Higher Education, Research, 
Innovation and Science. 

The Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development Plan Delivery and 
Reform hereby consents to the foregoing Scheme. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

30 August, 2023. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure, National Development 
Plan Delivery and Reform. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [429] 

An tÚdarás um Ard-Oideachas hereby approves the foregoing Scheme. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of An tÚdarás um Ard-Oideachas, 

30 August, 2023. 

DR. ALAN WALL, 

Chief Executive Officer, An tÚdarás um Ard-Oideachas. 

GIVEN under the Common Seal of University College 
Dublin, National University of Ireland, Dublin., 

30 August, 2023. 

MARIE O’CONNOR, 

Chair, Governing Authority, University College Dublin, 
National University of Ireland, Dublin. 

ORLA FEELY, 

President, University College Dublin, National University. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [429] 5

title: accordance with the Fifth Schedule, of the Universities Act 1997 (No. 24 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The purpose of these Regulations is to adopt the Rules set out in the Schedule to 
the Rules for Pre-existing Public Service Pension Scheme Members Regulations 
2014 (S.I. No. 582 of 2014 ) as a scheme for the granting of superannuation 
benefits to or in respect of members of the staff University College Dublin who 
are not members of the Single Public Service Pension Scheme or the University 
College Dublin, National University of Ireland, Dublin (Closed) Pension 
Scheme 2010. 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [429]
